title: Robustify tests wrt to PY2 vs PY3
body:
Below is a test that fails in our singularity image, because there is no PY2. Would be could to not require that. @kyleam ?

```
======================================================================
ERROR: datalad.interface.tests.test_run.test_rerun_subdir
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/datalad/interface/run.py", line 173, in run_command
    expect_fail=True,
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/datalad/cmd.py", line 520, in run
    raise CommandError(str(cmd), msg, status, out[0], out[1])
datalad.support.exceptions.CommandError: CommandError: command 'python -c 'open("test.dat", "wb").close()'' failed with exitcode 127
Failed to run 'python -c \'open("test.dat", "wb").close()\'' under '/tmp/datalad_temp_test_rerun_subdir7r6913gm/subdir'. Exit code=127. out= err=

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/nose/case.py", line 198, in runTest
    self.test(*self.arg)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/datalad/tests/utils.py", line 1290, in newfunc
    func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/datalad/tests/utils.py", line 664, in newfunc
    return t(*(arg + (filename,)), **kw)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/datalad/interface/tests/test_run.py", line 408, in test_rerun_subdir
    run("python -c 'open(\"test.dat\", \"wb\").close()'")
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/wrapt/wrappers.py", line 523, in __call__
    args, kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 466, in eval_func
    return return_func(generator_func)(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/wrapt/wrappers.py", line 523, in __call__
    args, kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 454, in return_func
    results = list(results)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 411, in generator_func
    result_renderer, result_xfm, _result_filter, **_kwargs):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py", line 478, in _process_results
    for res in results:
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/datalad/interface/run.py", line 100, in __call__
    for r in run_command(cmd, dataset, message):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/datalad/interface/run.py", line 193, in run_command
    raise CommandError(code=cmd_exitcode)
datalad.support.exceptions.CommandError: CommandError:  failed with exitcode 127
```
